Requires Ralph Wiggum Loop skill for execution
Assumes specific testing and tooling setup

best_practices: Keep tasks focused with 4-8 checklist items for optimal Ralph iteration
Use specific test filters to isolate feature tests during development
Configure project-specific commands in the tooling section
Add orientation tasks for unfamiliar codebases
anti_patterns: Creating tasks with more than 10 checklist items (too complex)
Skipping the dependency mapping between tasks
Using generic completion promises instead of plan-specific ones
Forgetting to configure project-specific tool commands

faq.question: What is Ralph Wiggum Loop?
faq.answer: Ralph Loop is an iterative development pattern where Claude repeatedly executes the same prompt, seeing previous work via git history.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Django projects?
faq.answer: This skill is Django-specific. Frontend or other frameworks would need their own specialized planning skills.

faq.question: How do I run the generated plan?
faq.answer: Use '/plan-directory:run <slug>' to execute the RALPH-PROMPT.md with Ralph Loop integration.

faq.question: What if tests fail during execution?
faq.answer: Ralph will stop and attempt to fix issues. The plan includes verification steps that must pass before proceeding.

faq.question: Can I customize the quality gates?
faq.answer: Yes, configure lint, format, type check, and test commands in the skill inputs to match your project setup.

faq.question: How does task tracking work?
faq.answer: Ralph updates PLAN.md after each task, marking status and filling quality gate results in the tracker table.
